intro: Impatiens pantlingii, commonly known as the Pantling's impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the genus Impatiens, which is part of the family Balsaminaceae. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique seed dispersal mechanism, involving a sudden burst of seeds when the capsule matures, is a notable botanical feature.
